description:
I tried this tutorial : http://wiki.openstack.org/NovaInstall/Austin and I have things to report.


Environment : 
Linux nova-server 2.6.32-24-server #39-Ubuntu SMP  x86_64 GNU/Linux running on a KVM virtual machine (may be the cause...)


1 : You can add 2 required packages in the doc : python-setuptools and unzip 


2 : Missing files :
I had to copy files in the installation dir :
cp /root/austin/nova-2010.1/nova/auth/novarc.template /usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/nova-2010.1-py2.6.egg/nova/auth/
cp -r /root/austin/nova-2010.1/CA/ /usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/nova-2010.1-py2.6.egg/nova/../
and have to process ./genrootca.sh in CA directory to get "nova-manage project zipfile IRT anne" working


3 : and finally I'm stuck here :

euca-upload-bundle -m /tmp/kernel.manifest.xml -b mybucket
Checking bucket: mybucket                                                                                       # hang a little
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 231, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 214, in main
    bucket_instance = ensure_bucket(conn, bucket, canned_acl)
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 87, in ensure_bucket
    bucket_instance = connection.get_bucket(bucket)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/s3/connection.py", line 275, in get_bucket
    rs = bucket.get_all_keys(headers, maxkeys=0)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/s3/bucket.py", line 204, in get_all_keys
    headers=headers, query_args=s)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/s3/connection.py", line 342, in make_request
    data, host, auth_path, sender)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/connection.py", line 459, in make_request
    return self._mexe(method, path, data, headers, host, sender)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/connection.py", line 437, in _mexe
    raise e
socket.error: [Errno 111] Connection refused
title: Austin installation fails on Lucid (on kvm)

comments.content:
I tried this tutorial : http://wiki.openstack.org/NovaInstall/Austin and I have things to report.


Environment : 
Linux nova-server 2.6.32-24-server #39-Ubuntu SMP  x86_64 GNU/Linux running on a KVM virtual machine (may be the cause...)


1 : You can add 2 required packages in the doc : python-setuptools and unzip 


2 : Missing files :
I had to copy files in the installation dir :
cp /root/austin/nova-2010.1/nova/auth/novarc.template /usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/nova-2010.1-py2.6.egg/nova/auth/
cp -r /root/austin/nova-2010.1/CA/ /usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/nova-2010.1-py2.6.egg/nova/../
and have to process ./genrootca.sh in CA directory to get "nova-manage project zipfile IRT anne" working


3 : and finally I'm stuck here :

euca-upload-bundle -m /tmp/kernel.manifest.xml -b mybucket
Checking bucket: mybucket                                                                                       # hang a little
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 231, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 214, in main
    bucket_instance = ensure_bucket(conn, bucket, canned_acl)
  File "/usr/bin/euca-upload-bundle", line 87, in ensure_bucket
    bucket_instance = connection.get_bucket(bucket)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/s3/connection.py", line 275, in get_bucket
    rs = bucket.get_all_keys(headers, maxkeys=0)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/s3/bucket.py", line 204, in get_all_keys
    headers=headers, query_args=s)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/s3/connection.py", line 342, in make_request
    data, host, auth_path, sender)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/connection.py", line 459, in make_request
    return self._mexe(method, path, data, headers, host, sender)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/boto/connection.py", line 437, in _mexe
    raise e
socket.error: [Errno 111] Connection refused
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~arthur-clement

comments.content: Can you make sure rabbitmq-server is running? In my installs that not running/installed caused this error.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jordanrinke

comments.content:
Well, you can check rabbitmq but it probably isn't the cause. I skimmed over where you were trying to do a euca-upload-bundle.

Is nova-objectstore running and have you exported the novarc file to have your env variables setup properly?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jordanrinke

comments.content: Waiting on input from the reporter
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: This is certainly fixed in bexar, and missing input from the reporter. Please reopen if you still experience the issue and can provide additional information.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
hi,Thierry Carrez:

I am using bexar to install and run nova on centos5.5, when execute this order:

euca-upload-bundle -m /tmp/kernel.manifest.xml -b mybucket

it occurs the same error as you:

File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/boto/connection.py",line 445, in _mexe raise e
socket.error:(111,'Connection refused').

any ideas ???
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~shihangwei

comments.content: The error you get means the client (euca-upload-bundle) can't connect to the API/objectstore servers (nova-api, nova-objectstore). Two possible reasons: euca-upload-bundle doesn't know or doesn't have the right place to connect to (did you source your novarc file ?) or the nova-api/nova-objectstore nodes are not running.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
